title: Naga ed-Deir
description: The necropolis associated with the unlocated city This (Thinis), capital city of the unified Egyptian kingdom in the Early Dynastic period. The necropolis stretches for 1.5 kilometers and contains thousands of burials from the Predynastic period through the early Coptic period, with particularly large numbers of burials from the Predynastic period (ca. 3800–3200 BCE) and the late Old Kingdom-First Intermediate Period (ca. 2300–2061 BCE).

properties.description: Point representing the location of Naga ed-Deir, from Podzorski 2001.
properties.title: Imagery location of Naga ed-Deir
